Package org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.connectors.properties

Class Connections

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.connectors.properties.beans.PropertyBase
      • org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.connectors.properties.PropertyIteratorBase
        • org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.connectors.properties.Connections
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.Iterator<Connection>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectedConnections
    public abstract class Connections
extends PropertyIteratorBase
implements java.util.Iterator<Connection>
    Connections supports an iterator over a list of connections. Callers can use it to step through the list just once. If they want to parse the list again, they could use the copy/clone constructor to create a new iterator.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connections

        public Connections​(int totalElementCount,
                   int maxCacheSize)
        Typical Constructor creates an iterator with the supplied list of elements.
        Parameters:
        totalElementCount - the total number of elements to process. A negative value is converted to 0.
        maxCacheSize - maximum number of elements that should be retrieved from the property server and cached in the element list at any one time. If a number less than one is supplied, 1 is used.

      • Connections

        public Connections​(Connections template)
        Copy/clone constructor. Used to reset iterator element pointer to 0;
        Parameters:
        template - type-specific iterator to copy; null to create an empty iterator

        protected abstract Connections cloneIterator()
        Clones this iterator.
        Returns:
        new cloned object.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        The iterator can only be used once to step through the elements. This method returns a boolean to indicate if it has got to the end of the list yet.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<Connection>
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether there are more elements.

      • next

        public Connection next()
        Return the next element in the iteration.
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<Connection>
        Returns:
        Connection next element object that has been cloned.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Remove the current element in the iterator. (Null implementation since this iterator works off of cached elements from the property (metadata) server.)
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.Iterator<Connection>
